qas.question: For how many countries have rule of law aggregate measurements been developed?
What is the term that described a government based on the rule of law?
What is the Greek word for law?
What is the Greek word for power?
What is a key qualifier for determining good governance?

plausible_answers.text: the quality and good governance of a country

qas.question: What is the law of man a key dimension of?
What defines a rule of law is the extent to which people agree with the rules of society?
What is the Greek word for natural law?

context: The <a4_0>rule of law<a4_0/> has been considered as one of the key dimensions that determine <b5_0>the quality and good governance of a country<b5_0/>. Research, like <b6_0>the Worldwide Governance Indicators,<b6_0/> defines the rule of law as: "the extent to which agents have confidence and abide by the rules of society, and in particular the quality of contract enforcement, the police and the courts, as well as the likelihood of crime or violence." Based on this definition the Worldwide Governance Indicators project has developed aggregate measurements for the rule of law in <a0_0>more than 200 countries<a0_0/>, as seen in the map below. A government based on the rule of law can be called a <b7_0>"<a1_0>nomocracy<a1_0/>",<b7_0/> from the Greek <a2_0>nomos<a2_0/> (law) and <a3_0>kratos<a3_0/> (power or rule).
